entry.title: The Bread Baker's Apprentice: Mastering the Art of Extraordinary Bread
entry.author: Peter Reinhart
entry.comment: A great find from Bogeys in Davis detailing both the art and science behind modern breadmaking.  A bit fussy but an amazing guide to handmade bread.

entry.title: Epicurious
entry.author: http://epicurious.com
entry.comment: A remarkable resource from Conde Nast's line of lifestyle magazines.  Its been going strong for a number of years as a remarkably user-friendly site, even through those dark years of post-dotcom.

entry.title: Family Favorite of Epiphany Parish
entry.author: The Cookbook Committee, Ephiphany Ladies Guild, San Francisco, CA

entry.title: Sharing Our Favorites
entry.author: The Dana Guild, Senshin Buddhist Church, Los Angeles, CA

entry.title: The Joy Of Cooking
entry.author: Marion Rombauer Becker, Irma Rombauer, Ethan Becker

entry.title: A Book of Appetizers
entry.author: Helen Evans Brown
entry.comment: Part of a three-part set purchased at the SPCA book sale at Country Club Plaza

entry.title: The New Ground Beef Cookbook (Alpha Beta edition)
entry.author: Mettja C. Roate
entry.comment: A great find from my mother's collection of castoffs.  I new when I saw this thing it would be full of great finds and it did not dissapoint.

entry.title: World Ag Expo Favorites
entry.comment: Hilary brought this one home from the World Ag Expo. A community cookbook from good ag tradefair folk, you'd think there'd be mostly straight-ahead fair stuff, but wow!
